title.narrative: Anticipation Volcanic Eruption in Goma, DRC

description.narrative: The immediate impact of the project is increased awareness of the targeted communities exposed to high risks of a volcano eruption on what to do before, during and after volcano eruption. In the long term this increased preparedness, will reduce the number of deaths, injuries and trauma related to volcanic eruption. In addition, the project will facilitate to build the culture of living positively with a hazard.

This is a preparedness intervention that aims to contribute to the efforts of improving the preparedness of Goma and Nyiragongo population to future Nyiragongo eruptions. The overall goal is to contribute to the reduction of deaths, injuries and trauma related to a volcanic eruption. Christian Aid, CAFOD anc Action Aid will together focus on the 3 high risk zones of Goma (Virunga and Majengo quarters by Christian Aid and Murara quarter by CAFOD) and some villages of Nyiragongo territory (by Action Aid). The focus will be put on schools, public institutions including markets, prison, center of PLWD, and hospitals established in the targeted zones. in order to mitigating harm and losses, the project will : Support the improvement of the capacity of participating schools and public institutions in the high-risk zone to prepare for and respond to disasters, especially volcanic eruption; and for the Civil Protection and humanitarian actors to have an up to date information on vulnerable persons to inform their evacuation plans; Conduct the feasibility study of the evacuation sites; and support the early warning system operated by the Observatoire Volcanogique de Goma (OVG).
